The diagram depicts two people communicating and describes three key factors in successful communication: method, language, and confirmation. Communication is successful when the intended message has been received and confirmed.
Method - Before communication can begin, two people must agree on the method, for example, the written notes, talking, sign language, which language, for example, English, Spanish, or Japanese. After communicating, confirmation verifies the accuracy of what was communicated.
